review: Great place to have nearby the hotel during a convention. Food is always reliable. Service this week was as if the bartenders personally owned the place! Greeted warmly with smiles and handshakes each night. Always a heartfelt "thank you" from the crew for our business. Great times!

Quick Tip: 10% off your entree with a Yelp Check In! I have received good service here.  It's not outstanding, but it's good.  I typically get the soup and salad deal.  I tried the petit sirloin for $10.  I liked it, it came with two sides.  Free garage parking downtown is also a plus.

The restaurant is connected to my hotel and that is the ONLY reason I ate there more than once. The food is so-so. The Korean tacos had very little meat, the appetizer sampler with fried shrimp, chicken and ribs was over-cooked and the most of the ribs were left on the plate. I sat at the bar and only after I was ready to pay did the server ask how the food was. When told that the food was not good, they did not seem to care.  When a customer leaves half of the food on the plate, they need to ask why and then do whatever it takes to make it right. Managers need to walk through and check with customers, but this never happened. The servers at the bar were friendly but need training in customer satisfaction.

I checked into TGI Fridays onYelp & my server Samantha  told me they DO NOT accept the 10% off one entree - Check In offer; fromYelp because companies tend to copy codes??? The food was great (held up to TGI Standards), the view from the patio is beautiful and the service went from fast to dragging at a turtles place. However the server was very nice & made sure to check in on me often.

Nachos:  TGI Friday's obviously doesn't understand what nachos are. Ten chips arranged neatly in a circle on a plate with stuff melted onto them, which makes them soggy? These are NOT nachos. I had them in London, England first, and thought it was just the British flaking out about nachos, being less familiar with Mexican food and all. Then I realized these are actually what TGIF serves world-wide. Fail. Atmosphere:  I don't really like it here. It's sort of generic and the staff uniorms make them all look like sad clowns. Service:  Probably average at this TGIF, though one time in England they had half the restaurant empty and refused to seat us because they had "no room". We tried to point out that half the place was empty, but they just insisted "Well, we're full, you'll have to wait 45 minutes". No explanation. We left and went to Outback instead.
Food was good. Standard fare. Took a long time though for a restaurant attached to a hotel.

Don't honor coupons here...had to request to see the 2 for $15 and 2 for $10 menu...have to cook a steak 2 times to make it well done.  You would think that they would be a little more upscale because they are attached to the JW Marriott...NOT!!!!!  That is so tacky and our party of 6 is not pleased at all. Two thumbs down!

Extremely bad service.  I was in Indianapolis just for the day on business and wanted to eat out late.  This TGI has NO hours posted on the front.  I walked in around midnight (locations are opened to 2 am where I live) and freely sat down at the bar.  No one bothered even talking to me so I went up front.  The hostess had her back to me the whole time and never even bothered turning around once.  I had to ask the front desk at the hotel next door to find out that they were closed at 12.  Crappy service overall.

Got in late and needed something to eat. Friday's is Friday's so there's not much to say other than 1) they have some decent wines at this location (Mondavi? Not often you see that in a low-brow chain) and 2) it's not often that I'm reminded of what bad food is until I come to places like this. The pretzels and beer cheese gave me such intestinal discomfort that I thought I might be afflicted with Crohn's disease. Aubrey was good as a server so I'll give her props for that but it's too bad she's following a mention of intestinal distress. Sorry, Aubrey.

We had a party of 14. At first, the host said it was a 45 minute wait. After that, she said she couldn't tell us how much longer. We said we were willing to split up our group of it helped. She was overwhelmed and acted annoyed we were there. The trash bins were overflowing. The floors needed swept. All this convinced us to leave. If a big event is going on, don't bother going here.

Upon entry, there was a wait, but it was open seating in the bar area, which I had to ask the hostesses for when it should have been offered when we almost went on the half hour wait list.   After grabbing a table, we ordered Mac & Cheese bites.  Ok, but not great.  Wouldn't order them again.  Very small portion size and taste was just ok. Blue cheese coated steak was very good.   The most noteable thing was the service, or lack thereof.  Because we were sitting in the bar area on the bar side, we had one of what looked like 4 bartenders as one of our servers.  One would think that on the weekend of the Brickyard 400 they would have had more staff on to handle more customers.  Poor planning. Seemed ok, but I wouldn't go back during any time of big events.  Between the inept hostesses and the short-staffing in the bar, it would be questionable to go on weekends.
Even though there is a 10% off coupon, they have no clue what it is and won't accept. They're a franchise and not corporate. Don't try and use it. You'll be shunned.
Food is typical. Nothing special, just what you would expect. But don't count on the on the 10% off that is the check in offer. They don't honor it.

Wow. $115 for three meals and a few drinks. Everything was just so so. Ribs tasted and looked old. Beer cheese soup dip was cold, asked for a little more and warm this time, charged us $2.99 for a to go soup and there was probably 3 bites to it. I knew what to expect from a TGI's but all I was TGing was that I didn't have to eat there again. What a rip.
Unfriendly and inefficient service. As a guest of the Marriott, I called for room service and got put on hold three times by three different people. No one ever came back to take my order.

It's always a shame when you check in to a place via your Yelp app, get so excited when you receive a discount and then am told by a worker that they're not going to accept your Yelp discount. What?! How is this possible? Is the world against me? And then negative thought after negative thought comes to mind.  So that was my first experience. haha Fortunately, I love the food at T.G.I. Friday's and had no issue with paying full price. It's just the fact that I'm such an avid Yelper and I get incredibly excited when I see a business that has paired with the discount side of Yelp land. Whatever the true backstory of their reasoning was, it was just disappointing.  There's always next time!

Good service but food was only ok. Ordered steak and spinach cooked medium and received a very well done piece of meat. Sides were awesome as was flatbreads. Beer selection is good. It is nice if you are staying at JW Marriott, but better places are a few blocks away if you are willing to walk.

I never go to TGI Fridays, so I don't know what state of insanity made made me go to this one on a recent business trip to Indianapolis. Lunchtime. 20 min. wait. 10 min. wait to get my drink. And it wasn't crowded?! This is what happens when laziness encroaches and you deny yourself a decent meal. Never again. I couldn't even muster up any sympathy for the less than stellar server. Food not worth mentioning.

I was really hoping when we sat down that the complaints from the other table weren't going to follow us, we'll they did. We waited for an hour to get our dinner and then it was wrong, they manager was a kid and not very professional, our waitress seemed to want to blame everyone except herself. So if you stop here to eat hope you have lots of time.

Although the ambiance of this Friday's is significantly nicer than most others I've been to, it left a lot to be desired.  First, we walk in to see lots of empty tables but are told it will be a long wait unless we sit at the bar.  Evidently they don't believe in letting a party of two sit at a four-top in the non-bar area even though they weren't busy.  After sitting at the bar, we were "greeted" by a server who was clearly pissed off at something and decided that was a reason to treat us rather rudely.  The next let-down came when we were informed that this particular restaurant doesn't participate in the TGI Friday's promotions that you see on TV.  This must be a way for them to cash in on everyone staying in the surrounding hotels.  After that it got better.  The food was delivered quickly and we had no complaints with the quality of the food.  The actual meal was exactly the same as what you would expect from any other Friday's.  Unfortunately, the quality of the service staff and management's choice not to partake in promotions with the rest of the chain made it a worse experience than what you will get at other Friday's locations.  Unfortunately, I would not recommend coming to this particular Friday's.  You'd be better served going elsewhere around town.

One thing going for this T.G.I. Friday's is its location. It is located on the Courtyard/ Fairfield Inn & Suites side in cluster of Marriott properties, and if your staying here or visiting the White River State Park or Canal and don't wish to walk a few blocks, it can be one of the cheaper options when compared to the restaurants in the JW. This Friday's is one the larger size and its crowd seems to vary based on the conventions and other events downtown. Service here can vary extremely. I have had some of the best and some of the worst service here.  In terms of menu, they have most of the typical Friday's options. On the regular menu, they do now list what items can be altered to be gluten free, but I would highly stress your dietary needs and concerns with your server, although you may find that there might be some confusion. I would also recommend to verify what sauces that they use, especially soy sauce.  Also, they do list the fries as being gluten free; however, they don't have a dedicated fryer, so depending on your sensitivity, you should take this into account. Also, like many other restaurants, Friday's is a shared kitchen environment and there is a chance for cross contamination.  In terms of GF food, the choices are limited and kind of pricey for the quality of what you get. If you do have a gluten allergy, I would just walk the 2.5 blocks for other options.

The service was horrible. I waited for almost 30 minutes for my food to be delivered to the table. And when my food was delivered it was all cold. The only bright side is that the manager offer 20% off. But I would have rather had hot food. I will not come back to this place even if I have a 30% coupon.

Horrible service and workers. This is the first time I didn't even tip. This location doesn't acknowledge national promotions such as $10 Endless apps because they're owned by the Marriott hotel. Not even discounts for their employees. I work for the Marriott and as an employee I get 20% discounts on food. I ordered a meal for full price and told them I worked for the Marriott. I even showed them my discount card, but the bartender just looked at me and said "we don't give discounts anymore." WTF!!! Whenever employees from other Marriott properties come to my hotel I always take care of them, but when come to your property you can't do the same? Really??? Never again
The food was good but the staff and service was great! Had the ribs and watched the game.
Service was great the two nights I came here - the waitresses and hostesses were friendly DVD the food came quickly. I got a burger the first night and a rib-eye the second.  Loved them both.
Tough call, the service was great, the waitress was really friendly and prompt.  But the food was just gross.  Greasy and tasteless. I don't know what I expected, but I wasn't pleased.
Soup, salad, and meal all arrived at the same time.  Waitress was nice and made things right. Food was just OK. Downtown prices for suburb meal.

Called to make reservation was told they don't take them had a party of 14, get there an when we check asked why we didn't call ahead , then sat in a area where there were 3 other tables waiting to 25 minutes to get drinks an still haven't ordered what a shame I mean we are at a hotel combo..... Lessened learn

This is a great Fridays restaurant. The staff is excellent and the food is always tasting great! They have awesome sunday specials for alcohol and sunday through thursday food specials. They have awesome wings burgers fries. Their JD grill is also excellent! I would recommend this restaurant for fun nights out as well as families.
So I stopped in fridays for a drink and some awesome food!!! Amazing service:) best experience ever!!!! This is the best fridays I have ever been to hands down!!

this was my first time eating at a TGI Fridays and I probably won't be eating there again any time soon. service was not great and the food was nothing remotely close to the menu. the dish I ordered did not taste at all like what was described (not just what it looked like). portion sizes for the appetizers were also a huge disappointment... way too small! Could be just the location we went too... doesn't look like they have much love on yelp.

I had lunch delivered through Order Up.  I ordered the Choose Three - Thai Pork Tacos, Chicken Skewers, and Bacon Macaroni Bites.  Don't bother with the Macaroni Bites - they were awful.  The Chicken Skewers were supposed to consist of TWO skewers - I only got ONE, with four little bites of chicken, two pita bread quarters, and a tablespoon of lime coleslaw.  Tasty but not worth the price.  The tacos were soft tacos, about 2 1/2" in diameter with about a teaspoon of filling each, and were tasty.  Considering that with delivery fees, processing fee and tip, I spent about $25 for lunch, 1/3 of which went into the trash, I am still hungry and feeling ripped off.
I travel a lot and have to say this is the worst Fridays I have ever been to- the food was served cold & the bread was stale.

As I was leaving this downtown Indianapolis location of T.G.I. Friday's this afternoon after having joined a party of 9 other co-workers for a going away lunch for a peer, it occurred to me that perhaps my first mistake was visiting a T.G.I. Friday's on a Thursday.  This particular location has a built-in customer base being located in the midst of a cluster of Marriott hotel properties and within a block of several area museums, a baseball stadium, and other tourist attractions. As is true of nearly every T.G.I. Friday's I have ever been to, this particular location has the usual touristy/sports bar feeling to it with pop culture decorations and a number of televisions hung from ceilings around the restaurant. The usual T.G.I. Friday's decor remains in place here.  In terms of wheelchair friendliness, that entirely depends upon where you're coming from - if you're actually in one of the neighboring hotels, then the trip is relatively easy with well placed curb cuts. I will say that their two sets of glass doors are relatively heavy, and I was grateful for the employee who did arrive upon my entrance to help out.  If you're coming from anywhere other than the area hotels, you'll likely have to deal with sidewalks that are in a good condition but there's lots of heavy traffic around. So, it might be best to visit with a companion to ensure maximum safety.  One of my co-workers arrived at the restaurant early to make sure we got a table in a timely manner given that all of us were on our lunch hour. So, I will admit that when we all arrived several minutes later that I was a bit disappointed to see that no real effort had been made to arrange the tables appropriately. It only took a few more minutes, but it was an early indicator that the entire meal's pacing was going to be a tad off.  We all arrived and were seated at grouped together tables that accommodated us pretty well, though it was a bit chilly being near the front door. I did look around and noticed at least a couple areas of the restaurant that were clearly not wheelchair friendly, though I do give the staff credit for actually removing a chair for the spot my wheelchair needed. I ordered a classic cheeseburger that comes with seasoned fries. I ordered the burger medium-well and also ordered my usual unsweetened iced tea. They offer a few "pairings" offering lunch discounts, but none really struck my fancy.  Our drink orders were taken. They arrived a few minutes later. Again, it seemed a tad slow to me. The food arrived pretty much all at the same time, which I'm aware is practice but it seems to me backfired here.  What do I mean? The burger, which I'd say was medium rather than medium-well, was cold. I'm not kidding. It was actually cold, not even kind of warm. The bun, which had obviously been toasted, was also cold and bland tasting. I won't quite say it was all dreadful, but it was certainly massively disappointing. The lightly seasoned french fries would have likely been semi-decent if they hadn't also been right on the edge of being cold. The food tasted like they'd allowed it to sit out waiting while everyone else's meals were finishing up. I have no idea if that's what actually happened, but it sure tasted like it.  The iced tea was good, but they broke my cardinal rule by not offering a refill despite the fact that we clearly had down times and my glass was clearly empty. I always expect a refill offer, but that's especially true for a $2.99 drink. The process of getting the check also seemed to be just a tad slow. Jennifer, our server, was friendly but the whole atmosphere just seemed overly casual. You would think you'd be going for a decent tip with a group of 10, but our presence seemed like it was irrelevant.  Overall, I knocked off a star for the accessibility issues and I'm knocking off a star for the slower customer service and lack of an iced tea refill. The final star gets knocked off for serving up cold food. The final bill was just over $12 or so, and I definitely did not get my money's worth.  Indy's really growing in terms of quality restaurants, so unless you are stuck at the hotel with few dining options I can't think of a reason to venture over to this location of T.G.I. Friday's. I enjoyed spending the time with friends, but this won't be a place I plan to visit again unless I just happen to be in the area and am feeling too lazy to wheel a few blocks farther.

We met friends staying at the attached hotel for dinner. If it were any warmer, we probably would've walked somewhere else. But, it was below zero, so Friday's it is. I bet that's how many people make the choice to eat here. It's not really a place where you say "You know what? Let's go to Friday's tonight!" It's a place you go because it's there and a better place isn't.  It was busy due to a nearby convention. That said, I'd give the staff some slack. But I can't give them enough slack for how awful it was. We arrived to no greeting and met our friends who were already seated (we arrived late because parking was kind of nonexistent. Every attached garage but one was blocked off). We then waited roughly 20 minutes for our server to arrive to take a drink order and give our friends a refill. We ordered everything while we had her there. About 15 minutes later two of our four drinks were brought to the table. The other two arrived shortly after. Then, probably a half hour after ordering, three of our four meals arrived, leaving one in our party to stare at us as we gently picked at ours, waiting, hoping his would come.  The food was less that mediocre. And the price was higher than many better downtown restaurants. My chicken breast was small and dry. It was an a-cup in comparison to the menu photo's "Gentleman, please welcome to the stage Crystal" (Warrant's Cherry Pie blaring at the chicken strip club full of sad, single roosters) breast.  When the final plate arrived, the steak was overcooked and the plate looked like it had been thrown together. Terrible experience. Inconvenient if you're not staying at the hotel. Next time, we'll just pick them up and drive somewhere better.

Orders a steak and lobster tail to my room at the courtyard Marriott last night. They said it would be 30min, it came in about an hour with the stake completely cold and they forgot the lobster. I called and they brought the lobster, then called to tell manager the stake was completely cold and instead got put on hold for 10 min....(I hung up at that point). Never ordering from here again,
Drinks were overpriced and weak. EXTREMELY WEAK!  Margarita was like straight lime juice.  Time to find a different place to eat and have a few drinks!!

The food was weak. I order steak and lobster. The lobster was cold and way to smoky. The steak was not hot and chewy. I haven't had Fridays in years and only went with family. I won't be going back there are many places better. Eating at Fridays felt like a rookie mistake.

I got the bacon wrapped stuffed jalapeños as an appetizer and pecan crusted chicken salad as an entree. The stuffed jalapeños (you get 4) were good but I'd pass on getting them again. On the other hand, the pecan crusted chicken salad was great! I would recommend a little more flavor for the chicken but otherwise, I would get this dish again.  Side note, this restaurant was a bit more pricier than I expected...

Waited another 10 minutes standing at the bar, after my wife stood there for 5 minutes before I arrived - parking car a quarter mile away I the rain.  Not a very warm welcome - will not be back period.

Worst TGI Fridays in the USA. I've come here multiple times and it's always slow service no matter if they are slow or busy. In fact, somehow the service is worse when it's slow. Just waited 30 minutes to be seated as they said it would only be 30 minutes. We went to ask how much longer and they said another 20 minutes. Half the restaurant wasn't even open! They said they didn't have enough servers. Really?!? It's 4th of July weekend! Every time I come here though they never have enough servers. Who's managing this joke of a restaurant?????

Not my first visit. The service is very bad. Slow, lacking and uninterested. The tables that we were looking to sit at were all dirty from a previous group. There was only four of us and they could not bother to offer refills on drinks or check back with us at all. The place was not busy at all, yet it was as if they were slammed for a weekend lunch. (It was 2:30pm on a Tuesday and no groups were active in the JW Marriott or the Convention Ceneter.) The food seemed okay, however I did not feel very well a few hours after. There are several other places within walking distance that are much better at what the do.

If I could rank it -100 I would. Open seating in the bar and no one came for 15 minutes. I had to walk to the bar to get someone's attention.  A waiter finally came 5 minutes later.  Awful service.   Not worth the wait. We should have just walked somewhere else in the 90 degree heat.  We probably would have gotten our food sooner.  Unless you want to waste your time and have terrible service walk somewhere else.

After the mass and crush of GenCon, my friends Brian, Joseph, and I staggered out of the Indiana Convention Center fatigued, bleary, and ready for a decent meal.  We settled for TGI Friday's.   Okay, that was mean.  Our experience at TGIF wasn't too bad, all told, though I'm not a fan of the chain overall.  I tend to find the whole franchise overpriced and rather mediocrely produced. That said, our experience at TGIF Indianapolis (the one adjoining to the JW Marriott complex) wasn't too bad at all.  My flat iron steak was competently cooked and reasonably seasoned, with creamy mashed potatoes.  But, while I typically love tomato-mozzarella salad, this one was simply not.  While tomatoes, onions, and a decent vinaigrette were present, there was not one single bit of mozzarella to be found on either mine or Brian's servings. Service at TGIF was similarly mediocre.  Our waiter was perfunctory, at best, and didn't offer to refill my drink throughout my meal.  He did his job; no more, no less, which isn't exactly a glowing review. We went here because it was convenient, and it was.  The food was decent, the service was okay, and the ambiance was the typical over-produced chain garbage.  To quote Othello, "Speak of me as I am, nothing extenuate, nor set down aught in malice, of one that lov'd not wisely but too well."
Half the members of our group died from starvation while waiting for our food. The remaining members of the group feasted on our dead friends. They were good.

It's Friday's... No, that's not an insult. It's just Friday's. There's something on the menu for everyone. I love the apps. I love the drinks. I've had some of the best mac and cheese bites ever here. Mmmmmm bacony goodness. Now, let me tell you about this Tennessee Whiskey Cake... Holy moly. Good googly moogly! I can eat this thing faithfully, at least 3 times a week. I don't even know what kind of cake it is! It's delicious though. I'm LITERALLY trying not to go get an order while I'm typing this review... I'll probably be in for it before the end of the month.

I was a regular at TGI Friday's for the last six years, but haven't been back since my last experience. The waitress incorrectly understood that I was ordering an appetizer combo, and ordered me three full sizes of those appetizers. When they arrived, she immediately realized her mistake and asked management how to fix it. She didn't come back for about five minutes, so I went ahead and started eating my food! When she came back, she told me she was taking all the food she'd delivered to me and would bring out the correct sized order once it's made. I was left waiting for fifteen minutes while my boyfriend ate his meal. Once the correct sized order came to my table, I'd lost my appetite and desire to eat at TGI Friday's in the future. Had management instructed our waitress to keep the food at our table and modify our bill to the correct order, I would have been satisfied. However, their roundabout thinking and tactics wasted their money and ruined my attitude toward this once loved restaurant.

Two stars....and the only reason it's not ONE star is because my sister didn't have the same problem as I did.  I don't like this place. Won't be back. The bread on my burger was old and they were in denial about it. I was offered new bread. And then I was offered nothing else. We were told our Yelp coupons were (and I quote) "FRAUDULENT" and were not to be used at that location because it was offered without their permission. The waitress also let us know this was an exclusive friday's location or something. I don't remember her describing word, but it was quite off. This is not an exclusive fridays and they don't deserve a capital ' f ', unless we're talking report cards. This place should be called "Case of the Mondays".  Because that's what it was. A big fat Monday with very old bread.  The manager was less than thrilled to address my concerns. Here's my thing:  If I'm paying you TWELVE DOLLARS to eat a cheeseburger (rather than purchasing my own hamburger and fixins for at home cooking), then I deserve for my bread not to feel like I could I break a concrete block with it. The bread was unnaturally hard on one side and soaked w/hamburger fixins-juice on the other. So I basically had what is usually an AMAZING cheeseburger served lukewarm (which I didn't even complain about) on half-n-half bread: Half soggy, half brick. The top bun was old as well. I know what old bread feels and tastes like. It has a different texture and thickness to it the older it gets (I"m speficially meaning hamburger buns). The bread also seemed much smaller than it usually is, or at least smaller than the buns I've had from ALL THE OTHER Friday's I've eaten this burger at. The fries were warm but not hot which meant they were cold and nasty quickly.  Clearly judging by how often I am checking in to a place to eat, I don't have a problem paying someone to cook for me. I do however have an issue w/serving me food that sucks and then looking at me like I should feel honored to eat it. When I told the manager the bread was the type of hard that signifies old bread, she looked at me straight faced and said 'that's not true, our bread is flown in from the South of France every morning'.  Ok I paraphrased it, but that might as well have been what she said and whatever stale face look you created in your head when you read that, is the stale face look she gave me. It reeked of 'I don't give a damn'. And she said that as if because they have bread come in the building daily, that means it can't be stale and old and hard. What reason do I have to spend my time playing with food? I came to eat, I did NOT come to complain, but I do want my food to be of quality.  I told her I didn't want it.  Her response: Ok. *Grabs plate and walks away*  And that was it. o.O ????  Yeah she comp'd the meal but no, she did not bother to say that. She didn't offer me a redo, which I was hungry enough to try it again. After all, I love Friday's and I love this particular burger. She just looked at me, grabbed the plate and walked off. The way she walked up to the table was the same nonchalantness of damns-not-given. I didn't know she was the manager and I definitely didn't think she was headed to our table w/such a lackadaisiscal demeanor. But she did...and as you can see, she stayed true to it.  Oh and how could I forget when I told the waitress my bread was hard as a brick, she asked if I wanted another bun. Another bun? A single bun? A single bottom piece of bun? LOL. No ma'am, I don't want a bun; I want a manager.  All in all, the best part of this trip was the knowledge that I will never again return to this place. It's quite dark and dreary inside and doesn't reflect all the work they put into beautifying the outside. So they can keep their Venice Italy-Flown In Brick Bread and their unconcerned management staff. Maybe they should take their mask off for Halloween and just be who they are: A Bad Case of the Mondays. I'm just way too snooty for this and that I can admit. * shrug *

I would have gone with 2 stars but the waitress was pretty cool. I have 2 receipts and one says Karen and one says Faith so I don't know who took care of us but she was good. The flat iron Jack Daniels steak was average and the sauce was well done. Broccoli was a little under cooked. My Flatbread Chicken pizza appetizer was horrible. The wait to sit was horrible. We ended up at the bar while we waited for a table. It was frustrating because it looked like there was plenty of staff and open tables but I probably misread the situation. The drinks were well done though and not watered down for happy hour. The drinks and waitress saved the day.

I really really love Fridays and I hate to give such a low rating, but I would hate for someone to come here and be disappointed like I was. If you're considering stopping at this Friday's, don't! Save your money and swing over to Scottys or Mass Ave for a better dining experience. When it comes to Friday's apps, burgers and that to-die-for Tennessee Whiskey cake I've never been disappointed. Honestly...never, but the service at this location was a little different since it's downtown. They don't do endless apps. They said the Yelp 10% off coupon was fraudulent (really? fraudulent?). The manager had terrible customer service. My sister's bun was hard. I don't know if it was hard stale or what, but it definitely wasn't edible. Our server asked if she wanted another bun...what? Where do they do that at? She wanted a freshly cooked burger. She only had a couple bites so it only seemed right to make another burger. The server got the manager who walked up to our table with no introduction or apology for the inconvenience and then stated that all bread is delivered daily. What does that mean? She snatched the plate and looked at me and said "What's wrong with yours?" I said nothing and she walked off whispering something to our server. She never came back. She didn't say what the resolution to the issue was. Nothing. Indianapolis has entirely too many restaurants to have to deal with mediocre service. I don't know why good service isn't part of the entire dining out experience. How do you expect people to come back? Maybe since it's a national brand in a good location they don't care because they know out of towners will drop in. Maybe this Friday's is just a To-Go spot. Whatever it is, I won't be back here. Unfortunately the location 5 min from me in Avon closed. I can still visit the W 38th St and Keystone at the Xing locations for my Friday's fix.

Meh is perfect for this. People aren't great, food is on par for a Friday's and it took forever to be served. Not a real "hip place" either, as it has the feeling of a filthy dive bar, even though it is a naitonal chain. Meh, meh, meh.

Pretty poor performance. Went on a Sunday night after seeing a couple ads on TV. Walked in to several parties waiting for tables while we saw 20+ empty clean tables and as many dirty. We grabbed a couple seats at the bar. Bartenders did a fine job. Speed of service was good. Did the 3 app option (this location doesn't do endless apps). Nice variety. Good. Cajun pasta and burger both good. Why the 1 star? The place was filthy. An hour after we arrived, the dirty table next to us covered in plates and glasses was still the same. Every empty table was full of dirty dishes. Never saw anyone trying to clean up. Never saw a manager. Clearly understaffed. Obviously not managed well. Upper management needs to get control of this place or close it. Don't risk it!

While the hamburger bun was soggy from grease. the service was some of the worst I have ever had. Apparently the person taking our order did not understand that an appetizer was to be served before the meal. We we seated for over 45 minutes before we received or appetizer. By the way it was 2:15 on a Sunday afternoon. I had to go search for someone to get my check. The manager was dressed I. What looked like work outside clothes

This Friday's is a hot mess!!!!! The staff (with the exception of one bartender) did not prioritize the customers. They were too busy having personal conversations, on their phones, or counting their money to do their job.  The one star is for Vernon the bartender. I would prefer to give him 5 stars actually. He was attentive and polite, aware of customers needs. He was the only employee I saw who seemed to care about the customers experience. Thank you!!  If you have other dining options go there! The service here is pitiful.

Such terrible, terrible service. We had drinks and dessert and it took over an hour and a half. We sat for 20 minutes after ordering our first drink. A man on the patio asked if he could sit at a table that was loaded with dirty dishes and the host told him "then we'd have to clean it off..."  Um...

A lot of people might be turned off by places like Friday's or Applebee's just because they're a cookie-cutter kind of chain. But this Friday's in particular is a favorite of mine simply because the bar tending staff is great.  I worked at an adjacent hotel for two years and came in regularly for a close lunch. I left 6 months ago and recently came back to the hotel for a week. I walked into Friday's and they all remembered me by name and it was like we were pals. It made me smile even though I (less than secretly) hate that I'm back at the hotel, even for a short period.  If you're in the mood for a decent local brew, they've always got a good couple of choices from Sun King on tap. If you're interested in maybe a combination you wouldn't have thought of, I love the Grey Goose Cooler. It's got basil in it, which seems shocking at first, but upon tasting is so refreshing and light, and the sweetness is on point. It's a perfect with-dinner beverage.

Trying to find this eatery from inside the JW Marriott/Courtyard complex was impossible.  We had to walk outside and go around the building to get our bearings. Our party of four had good food and service. However, all the food was on the pricey side.  I would return if I was staying at the Marriott again.

Well where do I start?? We were going to a baseball game and decided to have lunch at your restaurant. Not very busy, I would say 40 people there. It took 20 minutes for the server to come take our order. She suggested we have the "special". All 3 of us ordered it. It comes with a drink included. We all 3 have a beer. Beer comes about 20 minutes later. Server said beer with special would be "tall" it was short. OK  30 minutes later food comes. Very small portions. OK. Order another beer. 20 minutes later server says "beer is on the bar, be right back". 15 minutes later no beer. Manager comes buy, we tell her and she brings the beer.  We ask for the check. 15 minutes later check comes. One is 17.45 , one is 21.10 and one is 24.75?  WE ALL HAD THE SAME THING. Server gets the manager. They disappear for about 15 minutes and return saying " its a software issue and we have to contact our IT department if you can wait. At this point it is just so bad it's funny. We have now missed the 1st inning of the baseball game that started at 1:35 because of a lunch that started at 11:30. We finally just pay and leave. The comment was made. " good thing our wives weren't here. They would have raised hell.

Exceedingly poor service.  Went here for a quick bite cuz it's next to the hotel and we were tired. But not with it.  It's not cheap, 24-28$ for a steak.  No baked potatoes but the mashed pos were really good. Order a pizza to room service if you can't wait until morning to eat something.

Never get carry out here.  Apparently nobody can ring me up other than the carry out counter person who was gone for 20 minutes making a delivery to the hotel next door.  The manger apparently seemed fine with me waiting as I waited for my food to get cold.  It took 20 minutes for the manager to get a waiter to ring me up

Have you ever seen one of the bad episodes of "Bar Rescue"? This restaurant/bar could (or should) be on that.   We went Sunday night after the Indy 500 and wanted to get something without having to go far away from our hotel next door.  We walked in and noticed the outdoor patio was about 2/3 full and the other 1/3 looked like they had customers and had dishes leftover.   We went to the check-in desk and asked for a table for 3 outside. She told us that she could take our names. We then asked for a table inside, and she said it would be 15-20 minute wait. But as we looked around, about 20% of the restaurant had patrons seated. So we went to the bar.  Once at the bar, we ordered 1 beer and two wines. The bartender served the wine in brandy snifters saying that they were "out of wine glasses". We then noticed a woman walking around who had to be the manager.  She seemed oblivious to what was going on in the place.  Then we finally got seated inside. We ordered food, and another glass of wine (and got another brandy snifter).  The food was just OK, but I know it is cooked from frozen in convection ovens.

Terrible for a lunch stop. Have been waiting 50 minutes and counting for 8 lunch sandwiches/salads off the lunch menu. No additional information or check ins from our waitress. Will not be coming here again.

The service sucked. She was nice, just horrible at her job. Plates and glasses never left the table.   Cesar salad was basic, with small pieces of hard salad.  Cajun shrimp & chicken pasta was good enough, but almost room temp.   Had 2 beers,  no water in the 1:45 we were there. Waitress forgot food & drinks at our table & other tables nearby.  Manager never came by. Overall unacceptable in my eyes.

Sat at the bar.  Restaurant half full at most  Bartenders came and went and passed  Me no less than ten times in ten minutes I was Never acknowledged  No one working was smiling.  I walked out unserved,  Should be zero stars.  Question.  Why can every employee there be unhappy.  Do they hire only unhappy people ? Or are they made that way by management! Don't go here.  Bonus.   I walked 60 seconds to "high velocity. " Restaurant.  Awesome.

Food was just OK.  Service was awful, went there with the kids and sat outside and ordered appetizers.  We were there for 1-1/2 hours mostly waiting for the server.  We went to order some of their specials advertised on their website but were told this TGIF was not a participating location.  It's not like we were in Manhattan or a special location like an airport terminal... Only place we have been to in downtown Indianapolis that believes they are at the upper echelon they don't have to honor corporate specials!  At about 7 all the families with kids spilled out on the patio after they started playing club music super loud for the 7 other people in the restaurant.
Worst service ever!!! I'd pay you to not have to go through the agony of the service at this place!

When you walk into a downtown bar when there's a rock concert and a baseball game and there is no one sitting at the big bar, there's a reason!!! If you have an hour and a half to waste per beer go for it!!!

Stayed overnight in Indy for a concert and tried to catch some dinner prior to the show starting. While I, like others, typically like Fridays, this place was beyond awful. I seriously feel like they went to young adults who have never before worked a day in their life and let them loose to anger hungry patrons.  We noticed a line of people waiting for a table. We went to check for a timeframe and were told it would be about 30 minutes. It was after 5pm and they were not opening the bar area for people to sit. Excuse me? Okay, so we figured we'd go sit in the patio area outside. It was a nice enough evening and there was only one table seated out there. We were told that "Ummmm...I mean, there are people who were here before you waiting for an outside seat." Oh! Let me make sure I understand. So, you have 12 tables set up outside and only ONE is occupied. There are at least 3 empty tables inside that people could be sitting at but are not. Yet somehow....we need to wait 30 minutes to be seated? We left promptly. This is the most poorly managed restaurant I have ever been to in my 40+ years. Absolutely doing nothing but giving all the other TGIs a bad name. If I were the hotel attached to it, I would give this business the boot.

Food came out cold and sodas were flat. Service was pretty terrible as I could see all the waitresses rolling their eyes at each other the whole night. Management must be poor or lack of applicants is probably what would cause this...waited a long time for basic apps and again, they were cold and all fried frozen. Avoid this restaurant unless it is your last resort and are desperate to eat.

My family and I walked over to this location from the Indy Zoo. When we walked by the front, where the outside seating is, there were 2 groups of people sitting outside eating and having drinks. There were also 6 open tables. We went inside and asked if we could sit outside. The hostess told us no, they don't have a server. I don't know if we were lied to (maybe race, maybe they think families don't tip well, I have no idea) or they are so poorly run that the hostess doesn't know how to do her job. I pointed out that people were sitting outside and she said "well, they have dogs." So outside seating is for dog owners only?!? We left and won't ever return.

Went here last night for a late dinner with my daughter. This was probably not the best idea I've ever had because a bunch of young adults seemed to be there "pre-gaming it"  for a night out on the town. The wait for a table was five minutes, which left me wondering why the host had quoted us twenty-five minutes and referred the couple in front of us to another nearby restaurant/bar SubZero. In the beginning, everything was going smoothly, but then the table next to us asked to speak with the manager. I'm not sure what their complaint was, but that combined with the fact that I'd sent something back that I didn't want after seeing it, was obviously too much for Alison (our waitress) to handle. She completely shut down. She stopped checking on us; and when I was able to wave her down, she sent someone else to fulfill our request. The manager seemed equally as nonchalant as she was, so I wasn't very surprised. The icing on the cake was the dirty celery sticks they served with our boneless garlic parmesan wings!
Last night my family ate there, non of our food came out together it was barely warm and took almost a hour to get we will not be back to this location .
We had dinner there with our friends. Great atmosphere and food, service was courteous. Big portions, happy experience. Try their signature teas, they are wonderful.

Horrible customer service, my husband and I had just arrived from the air port, this was the first place we saw next to our hotel room so we had to come here. Our experience with the waitress was interesting, she didn't know her beers, the menue was falling apart, someone else had to come and explain the beers. She also took for ever to come and give us our bill and our change.
So this place totally sucked!!!! All around the service was really slow,,, almost walked out after waiting over an hour to get my food

I remember a time, except it was literally decades ago, when TGI Fridays was THE place to go.  It just isn't as good as it used to be.  I have to say we had a great server last night.  We got the quesadillas, and I really didn't like them very much. The chicken was so shredded that it was like the consistency of canned crab.  They were just off.  This particular location is not really convenient in that it's in - or on the back side of the JW Mariott.  While there are a few expensive parking garages around and if you are lucky some metered street parking, it's a few blocks walk just to get to it.  I have to say I still love all of the kitsch on the walls, but honestly, there are other and better choices in the downtown area.

Horrible service. They deliver to neighboring hotels so I placed my delivery order by phone and was told that it would be delivered in 30 min. When I called 1 hour later to ask for the status, I was told that they do not have my order. The manager did not even apologize till I complained that this was very disappointing. I will not order from this place again.

service at first was great, then as more tables filled it became very slow. frustratingly slow, to get drink refills was a battle an if you asked lets say the hostess, for help, she just looked at you. parking, did not know the validated, machine did not work, sent. ack to resturant for a pass, hostess knew nothing, manager had to tell her. when I got to the exit, the gates were open, no charge. that all wasted 20 mins. food was ok, but not what it used to be

AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL SERVICE.  We came here for the unlimited apps.  We have been here for 2.5 hours and have seen our server maybe 4 times.  We have gotten 3 appetizers and 2 refills on drinks.. currently waiting to ask for our check since our parking ends soon..did I mention that all of our empty plates and glasses are stacking up on the end of the table??

Wow this place is CRAP. First of all there is obvious racism from the staff. Also since when does it take 35 minutes to get meatballs oh wait they didn't come. Also Mozzarella sticks are supposed to be warm if not hot. ATTN TGI CORPORATE GET YOUR STUFF TOGETHER. This store is killing your brand and there are some good people here.  SUGGESTION PEOPLE go find another place to eat.

While staying in one of the nearby hotels I ate here more than I normally would because I wasn't feeling good and didn't want to go farther for food. That was OK, though, because the food and the service were both pretty good. I liked the burgers and the entrees too. The service was always friendly, more so than a lot of places. It turned out to be nice having Fridays here at the hotel.

I've been to better Fridays where the staff was cheerful and happy to be working. Poor Maddie was having a bad day.  I hope she takes a break to reflect where she'd  really like to work.  Hostess was upbeat and professional.  My breadsticks were overdone. My husbands plate was meh,  our hamburger was fantastic. Good luck in staying open.

I came here with my husband and 4 kids on a Sat evening.We were seated right away,ordered right away..I ordered a BBQ chicken salad which was wilted and soggy tasting,and a French onion soup which wasn't even brought out to me until 15 min after my salad.It tasted like Salisbury steak with a spoonful of salt. My kids got their meals and 2 of their orders were messed up.  We all ate,and 50 minutes later my husband's food still hadn't came! I complained to the manager,and even after that it took a while,till he finally decided to just take it to go! My husband ordered the endless appetizers,and never was asked if he wanted a "refill",and when he finally asked the waitress for his next choice of appetizer,she never brought it out to him. The waitress seemed so absent minded. The only good thing I can say is the manager was really nice when I complained and adjusted my bill almost 50% down.

So I'm reviewing my check ins and couldn't for the life of me remember going to TGI Fridays!  Was it that un-memorable?   But then I remembered, I walked over here after Pride and I reallllyyyyyy needed food and water if you know what I mean.  Sat in the bar and waited quite a bit for service. Maybe they were tired of the late night crowd but I was definitely ignored. When we finally received service, she was nice enough and recommended the all you can eat apps for $10.  What a deal!   We were able to get several apps that tasted decent at $10 each.   The only issue is that the service was soooo slow. Too slow for drinknrefills on drinks and getting the check.  It's so frustrating to wait for a check when you are ready to go.  For the food- the skins were fine but they clearly just use a slice of cheese- makes it look cheap. Pot stickers were tasty. Mozz sticks were ok but too thick.  Eh. That's all I can really say.

It is unfortunate TGIF has such a great location but performs so poorly.  We stopped here against my better judgement but it was right outside the hotel.  Let's see...   I nearly had to go behind the bar to get water (seriously),  the dirty dishes adjacent to us remained there for the duration of our stay, and food was served after the waitress emptied the garbage without washing her hands.   The food, I suppose, was amicable but recommended you fight off your hunger and uber to a better place further downtown.

We went on Tuesday and yes there was alot going on nearby, but we got there before the crowd and had to wait 10 minutes vefore we had someone come to the table. While waiting for our food 2 customers left the bar due to slow service. When we finally ordered i could see our what i assumed was our food sitting on the warming line for 10-15 minutes. When the food arrived i knew that i had seen i our food. French Fries were cold and soggy. The burger had no flavor im almost glad it sat under the warmer as long as it did otherwise they may have served me a tar tar burger, bun was now toasted on rhw outside. I had always enjoyed Fridays for a quick decent meal. This was not quick, well over an hour and was no where close to decent.

This is the worst TGIFridays I have ever been to. Filthy and the service was awful. There were plenty of tables open and no one waiting and we were told it would be a half hour wait. Seriously?!  So we get a drink at the bar. My Crown and Sprite was awful. I think the Sprite had moldy hoses or something. Thank God Crown has alcohol in it. We get a table a few minutes after we get our drinks and my husband finished his tall beer and still no server. So we paid the bartender for our drinks and left.

I visited here with a group of friends on Sunday for dinner while strolling around downtown. The location is superb, being very conveniently close to a lot of prime locations (the zoo, the state museum, the canal, victory field, etc). We walked in and were given the option to either sit in the bar or wait 45 minutes for a booth/table (because there were two large parties of 10+ each), so of course we all chose the bar. Each of us were given conflicting menu's, some of which were up-to-date with the current specials/prices and some weren't, so before ordering our waitress had to clarify. Our waitress took an extraordinarily long time to take orders, refill drinks, deliver food, and ultimately provide the checks. The food was average, the portions for some of the more expensive items ordered were not worth the money, and ultimately the service was pretty awful. It has been about 10 years since either of us had been to a TGI Fridays, and I think all of our group would agree it will be about 10 more years before we ever bother to come back. The selection, quantity, and quality of food, as well as the menu specials, simply don't compare to other similar restaurant options available. I would not recommend this restaurant.

Wow.... What can I say. The management needs replaced. The service was a clear reflection on the lack of leadership. I have never seen a place lock the doors because they were so slow to get people their meals and so backed up that a "15min wait" turned into 1 3/4 hours. The waitress was so upset and stressed that she couldn't get food out of the kitchen that she broke down into tears. How bad does a place need to be that the waitress is so embarrassed and frustrated that she ends up sobbing in the middle of the dining room. The food was under/over cooked. Out of 10 dishes zero.... Yes ZERO were correct. Management, even when requested wouldn't come to the table. I'm done with TGI Friday's (This Garbage Is Friday's)
Don't waste your money. Food was ok but smothered in pepper. The kitchen staff is so loud singing and laughing you can hear all over the restaurant.

This Fridays was the biggest letdown of all fridays. The fries were skimpy and stale. And they take away the endless appetizers at any point they feel like it so don't believe the advertising!!!!! Then they serve disgusting mango tea so don't order it.

My husband's chicken sandwich was undercooked so he sent it back. Not once did a manager come to the table to apologize and it was not that busy. We waited about 45 minutes for our food, and then had to wait another 30 min for a replacement burger. When we were ready to pay, the hostess had to hunt down our server which took about 10 minutes. The place is in need of a deep clean and management needs to be more involved.
Always slow service. Takes about 30 minutes for a burger, customer service is lackluster at best. Definitely save your money and go anywhere else, including McDonald's or steak n shake.

We don't typically review chain restaurants but this one is an exception because of their location and outdoor seating with a good downtown view. They're a walking distance to Indiana State Museum and The Lawn at White River. Food and service were decent and satifying, especially their grilled fish. Their Jack Daniels ribs are a must try.

Firstly, the food was quite good. No complaints there. My menu should have been burned. It was so sticky with BBQ sauce I didn't want to touch it. The drink menu had no prices. I asked the server about prices but she didn't know either. She guessed but ended up guessing under what I payed. That's annoying. My Long Island was WAY to strong and out of balance - I powered through though! Other that not knowing the the price of the drinks, my service was good. I got my salad and not 3 minutes later I got my entree. That is annoying because It's getting cold while I am eating my salad.

By far one of the worst "service" experiences I have ever had. Our waitress only came to our table about two times our whole visit there... one of those times because we had to flag her down for refills. When they brought our table our food, they forgot to bring out my mom's meal... having to flag her down again to bring this to their attention, we sat a good 20 minutes and her meal still was not brought out. Tired of waiting (keep in mind our waitress still hasn't been around to check on anything) my dad got up and had to go find a manager. I would have been sympathetic for the waitress had the restaurant been busy because I know what it's like being a server, but the restaurant was fairly empty. She had not come back to our table until she saw that we were leaving. Definitely do not recommend stopping at this Fridays!

Full disclosure: I doubt I'm the target audience for this restaurant. I came to this chain as a kid and haven't been in over a decade. It was steps from my hotel so I figured "why not?"  Unfortunately I haven't been missing much. The low prices are pretty remarkable. I don't recall paying any more than I did 10+ years ago despite inflation. However, the food is much worse than I remembered as a kid. Could be adult vs teenager standards?  Low prices? Absolutely. Value for money? Maybe. Good food? Nope.

Ok it's TGIF and I know what to expect but this was a bad TGIF. We got in early to Fairfield so decided to grab a bite here since it's beside hotel lobby. The bread was stale on my French Dip and the sandwich was very small. They brought out our sandwiches without the fries? The waitress advised us the fries would be about in a few minutes. Never had that happen before. I finished my sandwich by the time the fries got there. Very disappointed in a$12 French dip.
Friday night, place was empty, asked to sit near tv's and they put us in a back room with a tv the size of a postage stamp.  Waited and waited for service & nobody came.  Finally left.  Awful.

For being your typical, franchisee location, it wasn't too bad. This is my first time visiting at TGI Fridays in years, probably over 10 years. We visited during the lunch hour and although their regular menu can be pricey for just lunch they do you have a limited lunch menu. This is what we ordered from, and although there are only two options you can get lunch for $8. This included your choice of either a side salad, Caesar salad, or mozzarella sticks and a half sandwich or macaroni and cheese. We also ordered the potato skins as an appetizer and these are pretty good. Although pricey for lunch at just a franchise but the customer service was pretty great, our waitress was attentive and super friendly. The kitchen staff who brought out the food was also very friendly and accommodating. The location is clean and updated.

We went here for a work lunch a while ago. There aren't too many vegetarian options unfortunately. I asked for a quesadilla without chicken but was told that it couldn't be changed (it was premade I guess). I stuck to the blackbean burger which was delicious as were the seasoned fries. I want to give them 4 stars but was disappointed they couldn't accommodate someone with vegetarian needs.

Went to Winter Lights and was staying at the Marriot. Didn't want anything big so went with appetizers. First I thought prices were high but it's downtown so what do you expect.  Anyway ordered Brussel Sprouts .    I know your not a fan but I am.  Figured they would at least cook them. Came to me hard as rocks after 2.6 minutes in a deep fryer. I complained to the waitress but she just hemmed & hawed and didn't offer relieve. Too tried to get into it so I let it go.  Hadn't been to a FRidays in a while , won't be back !
